text: Not sure what happened to this place . Came here for meatball Parm and as I walked by the kitchen the person cooking food was on his cell phone not making anything but the microwave was going . I asked if that was my meatballs in the microwave and he confirmed . It looked as though the kitchen was closed , nothing was going on @ all . Just a guy standing around on his phone . I immediately cancelled my order and don't think I will ever be back . The standards have gone down the toilet in this place . It's too bad cause I used to love coming here.
You have to eat here! Go out of your way to get here!! Chicago style EVERYTHING!! Italian combo sandwich, THE BEST IVE EVER HAD!

Love the service. The staff checks on you to insure you are happy with your food. I usually have the italiano beef sandwich and fries. I did try the stuffed green pepper lunch special once, and it was very good. The food here  has never disappointed. As for the Beef sandwich, it's just the right amount of wet and the sweet peppers are tasty. The fries are nothing special, but they are fresh and hot.  I do recommend getting the fries on a separate plate to keep them crisp otherwise the sandwich will soggy them out pretty quick. Overall a nice little spot to eat lunch with daily specials.
And.. oh yeah, the chicken is great also.

I was visiting Las Vegas and starving but wanted something healthy. The "lunch" size Greek chicken salad was enormous, fresh and had the in house rotisserie chicken. Excellent. Really fast, cheap, and the chef from Chicago is friendly and knows how to make Chicago favorites. All plates appear to be really big. The place was packed - seems to be popular among locals - but I would never have spotted it or thought it was a place to get a great salad without searching on Yelp. Will definitely be back next time I am in Vegas.

I have been going to Sonio's off and on for many years, mostly for the chicken, which I think is great. However, the other day I stopped in and looked at the menu.  They had Chicago Italian Beef sandwiches on the menu.  I asked the waitress how it was, and she said it was her favorite, and was a big seller in the restaurant.  So I decided to try it.  I have tried Italian beef at Windy's Beefs and dogs, the Chicago Hot Dog place on Rancho, and south Eastern, all of which have been acceptable if not great.  The Sonio's beef sandwich came, and after the first bit, I almost swooned.  The best beef sandwich I have found outside of Chicago, where I was born and raised.  It was wonderful, just spicy enough, sweet peppers sliced thinly, bread wet (altho I needed at little more au jus).  My only complaint, if there is one, is that the fries were just not crisp enough.  Tasted good, and I ate a lot of them, but I would have preferred them a little crisper.   However, I can't wait to go back for another one!

Went for my first time to Sonio's with my fiance. She had been there before and recommended we try it. 

We went for lunch. My first impression was it's authentic. It seemed like a place you grow up going to as a kid. I ordered the roast beef sandwich and it was delicious! The meat had been marinated for a while and it tasted like it. She got the caesar salad with the gyro meat. The meat was awesome! Cooked well and the seasoning was amazing. I definitely recommend this place for some good eats. 

My only issue with the restaurant is it seemed a little less refined. The bowl the salad came in was chipped and our table wobbled quite a bit. Other than that it was perfect. I will definitely be back!

Yuck, would not eat here again.

Arrived around 12:00 pm for lunch.  Took a couple of minutes to get seated, but took about 20 minutes to give our order (flagging waitress down for about 5)

I had 1/4 chicken with pasta salad and fries.  When the generic tasting fries was the best item on the plate, there's a big problem!
Excellent as usual. Never have had a meal that I did not throughly enjoy!! Had the home made lasagna and sweet Italian sausage today. Yummy!!

Staff is really friendly. The restaurant is a little cluttered, but if you can look pass that you can enjoy some pretty good chicken. Tried the 1/4 chicken (all white) with side salad (delicious home made Italian dressing) and a side chicken pasta salad (a little too much mayo.) Id go back.

Staff here is super friendly.    I love the big salads- especially the Mexican ceasar salad.

Best chicken in town!

It is busy at lunch- so be prepared to wait or get there early.

I had lunch here this afternoon and then ordered the full chicken and two sides to go because he offered a 10% discount with a Yelp check in, but then he changed the price of the full chicken and two sides at the register. He charged me 23.99 for one chicken and two sides and said that included the 10% discount. When I got home, I discovered that they didn't include any pita bread, which is advertised as part of the deal. The two sides were only partially full of pasta salad and rice. He also rang up the wrong lunch ticket and only pretended to fix it charging me $2.50 more for my lunch than it should have been. He doesn't print receipts and so I discovered this when I got the email later. I'll never eat here again. Watch out! He's a rip-off artist.
This place RULES!! Family owned and operated by some amazing people!  The rotisserie chicken is my fave, but everything is great, authentic and you better get there early if you want a spot.

The staff here is absolutely fantastic, they're nice. and I would have given a much higher rating if the food was better. I had a hot dog, which is realitvely difficult to mess up on. Went in around 2:30pm on a friday, wasn't busy. Neither I nor my friend was very thrilled with the food.

The best chicken enchiladas ever! 
Everything is good. Huge portion sizes. 
Only open limited hours but worth going!
This was totally crap a waste of time.e and. Money. The burger was dry the bun was old and the lettuce was black. Please close

The moment we walked in, people greeted us, even from the gentleman behind the counter which is about 40-50 ft from the door. Nice people!
Service was on. Refilled waters without asking for more. The food came out in a timely manner, even though it appeared rather crowded.
The food was fine. Nothing exceptional but tasty and satisfied our palates. 
Looks like they're hip to technology b/c when I paid, he swiped my card on his iPad that was connected and swiveled on his counter. I left the tip and total on the iPad and signed it electronically. My receipt was emailed to me.

I like this place.

Best wet Italian Beef sandwich and Hot Gardenia I have ever had... Much juicier and with more taste by far then Portillo's. The Gardenia is truly to die for. I wish I had a Sonio's in Phoenix. My wife loved her Mexican chicken caesar salad too. My only complaint is that I cannot give higher than a five star rating!
Love this place for lunch. Family run place, staff remembers your name. Great value. They make their own dressings and Giardiniera. Try the Italian beef sandwich or rotisserie chicken.
First time here. Great service all around. Very friendly ! Only had the enchiladas but I thought they were very good ! Better than most.

Sonio's is a great lunch spot. I'm hooked on the Spicy Chicken Caesar with the white meat rotisserie chicken. Their dressing has a wonderful kick and it's so unique I return again and again. 

I have Chicago roots so when I saw that they have Italian Beef and hot giardiniera I had to try it. This is a well executed sandwich. The bread is fantastic and they melt the mozzarella just right, but the beef, au jus and giardiniera didn't live up to my favorite Windy City eatery in the valley. If they were the only game in town, I'd likely favor the sandwich a bit more. But I'll stick to the salads. They got a good thing going there!

Had the Chinese chicken salad, regular size, and it is HUGE ! very tasty too. Not too fancy; Mandarin segments, few almond slices, romaine, and chicken u hve the choice of white or dark meat, however white costs extra. 10% off your bill if u check in on fb or yelp. Staff is super awesome, it's like they love working there, and super attentive .  It's not a fancy place but a comfortable lunch place
Their Italian beef sandwich is straight out of Chicago.  The best.

I used to love to come to Sonios for lunch but today's experience was a disaster. After seating ourselves and looking over the menu I began to have 2nd thoughts about coming here. The menu is probably one of the worst looking I have ever seen. One side is completely scratched out and many of the items on the other side are also scratched out. Trying to figure out what they do and do not serve is a lesson in frustration. We waited and waited for anyone to take our order, including asking the person who brought us our drinks.Someone from back finally came out to take our order. As I ordered, I picked up my napkin and two roaches fell out. The waitress (?) didn't seem to notice and it was at this point I realized it was a mistake to come here. I informed the women we were leaving and offered to pay for the drinks but she said we didn't need to. We left and will not be returning.

Everyone at my work seems to like this place, and it's.... ok. But it's a bit too pricey for what you get.

They are supposedly famous for their rotisserie chicken, but to be honest I think that the stuff at Albertson's/Vons is better (and cheaper). In fact, even though rotisserie is supposed to help the fat drain away from the chicken, I nearly gagged on a gob of fat. Gross!

The food is supposed to be Mexican (or something) but it's pretty blah. There are no spices and the flavors are pretty much what a Midwesterner might interpret Mexican food to be. They insisted that the guacamole is made fresh, but when I asked for a batch that didn't contain tomatoes, they balked saying that they used all the avocados in the morning to make that day's guac. Uh, ok. That doesn't sound very fresh. Even Baja Fresh will give me a slice of avocado. 

The salads are large and people seem to like that and it also seems to be the best deal in the place. The quesadillas are ok, but then again, it's pretty hard to mess up a quesadilla that just has (rotisserie) chicken in it and cheese.

I try and hit up Sonio's several times a month.  The service is always top notch and never ever had bad service here!
The food is excellent.  They have the best tasting chicken and delicious large portion salads.  They are always tweaking the menu and adding more every week.  Just writing this review makes me want to go to Sonio's right now.  
Try the Chicken, with red potatoes, and the feta spinach salad....my fav.

A business that has been around for a LONNGG time. I know the owners personally. Yiorgo, Teddy and Lily all do a great job with this place. They give great customer service and make you feel right at home. I have to say the best thing about this place is the chicken. Sides are made fresh daily and some of the standouts are the spinach feta, Chicken pasta salad, roasted potatoes and spanish rice. Rotisserie Chicken tastes nothing like anyone else's. Great Salads, huge portions. Chinese Chicken Salad and Mexican Caesar Salads are both great options. The greek salad is also a popular item, but I personally was never a fan of greek dressing, I don't know why but I never was, and they put kalmata olives in it, which I just don't like olives in general. They make their own dressings. Also, they are known for their Italian Beefs and Chicago Dogs. Which both are top notch. Giardinera is home made, and so is the au-jus. Bread goes great with the beefs.

Finally, after years of driving past, I got to try Sonio's. Even better, after 20 years, a really excellent Italian Beef! If I had realized that they had this, I would have been here years ago.

I got the Italian beef sandwich, wet w/cheese and peppers and gardiniere. It came with fries and extra jus, which I promptly forgot once I bit into that heavenly sandwich. It was perfection! It was also ridiculously enormous, I couldn't even eat half.

Hubby did better with his Italian Beef/Sausage combo sandwich, and it was even bigger. I had a taste of the sausage, it was quite good. 

Considering the portion sizes, I think a $2 split/share fee is out of line, but that didn't come into play today.

Service was great, incredibly warm and friendly. 

We will definitely be back, and soon, but I think I'll order to go if I want to share my meal with another.

This place is crazy busy during lunch so arrive early.  The enthusiasm of the work to push tables and food is awesome.  I think I was greeted and thanked by everyone employee in the place.

The menu is pretty diverse with something for everyone.  You want pasta, chicken, hotdogs, salads, stuffed bell peppers this is the place.

I settled on a greek salad with Gyro meat.  I was hung and I ordered a large and that is what I GOT. Greek salad at its finest served in a large old school salad bowl.  I though I could eat it all but ran just a tad short.

When we checked out, I was thanked by the man behind the counter for supporting local business.  Whirlwind atmosphere, good chow...I will be back.

A good friend of mine ate here yesterday for the first time and he had to show me this place today. "It's that good" Amazing food had the stuffed peppers, get there early if you want to get them because once they're out there out. And they do run out of stuff peppers every day. service was good nice and friendly. I'll probably be back here Saturday with my wife.

Three and a half stars, rounding up for good service.

Drove past this place repeatedly, but when I wanted to give them a try they were closed: only open M-Thurs til 5:30PM, and on Fridays til 4PM. Limited hours unless you work nearby. Interior reminds me of an old school mexican restaurant.

Stopped by for an early dinner, love that they have a menu of 3PM-close specials.
Ordered the lunch portion of salad with chicken (spicy mexican caesar) and the chicago beef (hot and sweet peppers), upgrade fries to Greek style. Used Yelp check-in discount for 10% off, total was under $15 including tip. Not bad for two meals! Cashier was genuinely friendly, packed up order perfectly, and wished me a good day on my way out the door- unusual to see someone so perky so close to close after a long day of working that type of position!

Salad was fresh and delish- packed in an ingenious way, with ingredients in a ziplock to add your dressing (packed separately) and toss, then serve in your to-go box. So smart! Downside is that they gave me the wrong dressing (regular caesar instead of spicy) and I found a few small bones, but it was still damn delicious. Just wish I had some hard boiled eggs at home to add in.

The chicago beef? It was so good, I barely got a bite before my BF made it disappear in under 5 minutes. You know it's good when that happens! The au jus is one of the best I've had, the bread was clearly fresh, and the meat was moist and plentiful. Peppers were tasty, too!

It's so close by and so well-priced with the specials, that I know I'll be coming back for another salad soon. And yes, probably a chicago beef for my guy.

Am in town visiting family when I saw this place on the corner. I love a good Chicago dog and this place did not disappoint. They have interesting menu and I plan to stop my everyday while in town to try as much as possible. Very friendly staff. I love little places like this.
Try the GYRO...it's loaded with tons of thick and moist meat unlike a lot of other places.

The Italian Beef Combo is the best sandwich is Vegas. The roast beef is tender and juicy and the sausage is incredible. I put mozzarella, sweet and hot peppers on top and dip it in the au jus. Sonio's has great service and you always see the old guy in the corner reading the news paper. Highly recommend for lunch or anytime you want a true Chicago beef sandwich.

I love this place. The service is amazingly fast, the staff is super nice, they simply want you to have a good meal and enjoy yourself. I would go back here day after day. I got the salad with chicken, it is so amazingly large that I will have dinner and breakfast from the lunch size.  The chicken is moist and plentiful, the olives just the right amount of salty and the lettuce was fresh and crisp.

I felt incredibly appreciated, was able to get help with any questions that I had, and the atmosphere seems like everyone was having a really good time

Pretty legit Chicago food. Good beefs and Hot dogs. I wish they we're open later though. I will say it's a little pricey and it's weird to have a server when you are ordering a beef and fries, but it's still a good spot. The chicken is good as well. Worth checking out for lunch!
I come to this place 4 times a week. Food quality, taste and customer service are superb.

Pretty darn good food! The rotisserie chicken was a perfectly crisp, flavorful experience on the outside, with a juicy, slides-off-the-bone tenderness on the inside! The pastas were acceptably scrumptious accompaniments, and the lemonade had a freshness to its sweet flavor. I was also frankly impressed with the warm, friendly reception I received as a first time patron, which has guaranteed my return. Word of advice to the owners though: go for the gusto and do homemade biscuits; the tortilla was just meh. You've clearly got the talent in the kitchen, and a fresh Southern biscuit would be the perfect accoutrement to my meal. I'll be back!

Five stars for Lily and the staff at Sonio's today. I ordered catering lunch for 20 people; beef sandwiches chicken and of course they're awesome salad. Everything was absolutely delicious. Everything was packed securely...was ready when I arrived to pick up. Top of the line customer service!  And oh that rotisserie chicken is so moist.  Our quoted catering price included our drinks.
I had the Italian beef it was awesome. Also I'm on a Paleo diet and they can accommodate you here. Food was amazing. I will definitely be coming back. I wish they were open longer.

If only zero stars were an option! My boyfriend and I saw this place while driving by and thought we should try it out as we live right down the street. When we walked in we both really needed to use the restroom and the woman there, who said she was the owner, completely overreacted over it. While, I understand she wants to reserve the restrooms for paying customers I thought it was RUDE and EXTREMELY UNPROFESSIONAL in the manner and language at which she used to handle the situation. When I came from the restroom and looked at the menu I saw more than a few things that looked really good but I'll never know because my boyfriend informed me of her outrageous behavior. We decided to leave, having no point to prove and feeling insulted (we do not look like some bums off the street that can't afford lunch), and she exclaimed, "Ha! I knew it!" as we walked out. What a DISAPPOINTMENT.
I come here every week. Everyone who works at Sonio's gives very kind and fast service! I love it! Their lemon Caesar is a must!

Wow I can't believe I've never written a review for this place! Been coming here for years ever since I moved to Vegas and my co-workers took me here on my first day. Sonio's serves a variety of foods including rotissierie chicken, salads in ginormous bowls, 2 lb burritos and Chicago style Italian beef and sausage. Uncle Teddy, the owner, is originally from Chicago and if you're lucky he'll stop by your table to chat. They are only open from 11 am to 5:30 pm on weekdays mainly to serve the downtown business lunch crowd, and the staff here seems to remember all their regulars which is impressive. It can get busy here during the 11 am to 1 pm lunch hours but they move quick and there's never too long a wait before a table clears up.

I typically like to get the Chinese chicken salad, Chicago style hot dogs, Italian sausage or a combo sandwich. The Chinese chicken salad comes w/ the shredded rotissierie chicken that they roast daily, mandarin oranges and a light vinagrette dressing among other things and is overall a refreshing and filling salad especially with the portions they give here. Their Chicago style foods like the Italian beef/sausage/combo sandwich tastes even better with a side of giardiniera or G as they call it here, although it does cost a little extra.

They sometimes will have a special item that they made just for that day which is nice if you want something different. Some of the specials I've seen are lasagna or meatball subs. I've recommended this place to several friends who are not Yelpers but all of them now love this place. It's conveniently located if you work in the area and serve up great food that is made to order and comes out fast and fresh.

Just a quick review for now.  Today was my first time eating at Sonio's but I have heard goo dthings about this place.  I almost didn't have lunch today as it was so hot out that I didn't want to leave my office, but around 1:00PM I finally decided to go out.  Although I didn't know where I wanted to go I drove around first until I ended up on Valley View.  I was going to go to the food court at the Meadows mall until I remembered that Sonio's was just around the corner so I went right instead of left.  

I walked in and it wasn't busy...but oddly the parking lot appeared to be packed with cars.  I was greeted by a very nice lady who directed me to the counter for to go orders as I initially wanted my food for take out.  I got to the cashier, and never seeing the menu, the first thing that caught my eye was the fire dog and fries combo so I just ordered that for quickness.  I ended up eating it there because once again I got lazy and figured by the time I get back to my office the hot dog and fries will be soggy.  So I sat at one of the tables in the corner when my order shortly arrived.  It took about 10 minutes so it was pretty quick.  The hot dog was good but a bit on the soggy side (Chicago style with mustard, sport peppers, green relish on a poppy seed bun), the fries were so so (frozen crinkle cut fries) but fried crispy.  

Maybe next time I'll try a burrito or a wrap...

LOVEDDD! the meatball sub & chicken is delicious! 
I picked it up 
took about 10 mins
Cafe is on a busy corner during the day :/ butttt the food is worth it
& the workers are super nice!
will come back forsure
I always love the friendly great service of this place. They are extremely busy during the lunch hour but they are fast and the food is great.  Menu has a wide variety to choose from.

BEWARE: UNDER NEW OWNERSHIP. Ordering a business lunch from Sonio's was a horrible idea-- the Yelp reviews indicate Sonio's has been serving the area for over 25 years, but under new ownership they have no right to claim they're the same restaurant. The delivery driver was over an hour late, the food was very low quality, they got our order incorrect, and we ended up having to file a fraud claim with our credit card company. Do NOT order from here.  

Apparently they're under new ownership and the new owner is also the delivery driver (a delivery driver who laughed at our CEO for complaining about the delay and blamed us for getting lost even after we called him numerous times to no avail). The manager, Lily, promised to refund our meal, asked us for personal and credit card information, and then refused to process the refund. Nothing positive came out of this experience.

I have been here a few times and am blown away by the service of this establishment. These people are the nicest and most attentive people I've ever met. The food is delicious and fast. It's turned into my Friday stop. I feel at home here.

Sonio's puts any food I've eaten in California to shame.  Not only did we get greeted and seated before we could blink, but the owner/chef himself came up and personally walked us through the menu.  Such charm.  Amazing Greek/Chicago mashup with healthy options but I went for their special burger with what I think was sirloin with cheese, homemade 1000 island dressing threw crispy romain leaves, whole pickle spears, onions and tomato and it was to freakin die for. Plus a side of Greek fries which is basically feta cheese and herb heaven. Step aside In n Out! Super authentic amazing homemade everything.  My husband had a Greek salad which was massive and had some homemade dressing on it which the owner said he worked on for six months to get right. Passion translates into food. Well done! I would come to Vegas just for this. If I could give six stars I would.

CAN NOT BELIEVE I HAVEN'T TRIED THIS PLACE UNTIL NOW!! And today it was on a fluke that we were in the area paying bills. Yelp said "not open til 11am" and I AM SO HAPPY YELP WAS WRONG!! I looked across the street to the lit up door sign that said open, next to an open door, next to a sign with specials. Not to mention by 11am (the said opening time) they had at least 6 tables. Glad we got here when we did. 
Off top I could tell this was a mom and pop, mostly regulars type of joint. 
That does not intimidate me one bit. I more so try to think of, "how will they remember me if they are lucky enough to have me as a regular?" Let me just tell you, I AM THE LUCKY ONE!
It was our lovely CM Misti's review talking about "salads the size of small babies" that initially got me here. AND IT'S IN A WOODEN BOWL!?!? yesssssss! 
My love and I got a Mexican Caesar salad to split. When she brought us EACH out a huge wooden bowl full of salad, I thought there was a mistake. THIS IS ONE SALAD??? (lights shine down from above while music plays)
I hate it when things say "spicy" and then are not. NOT AN ISSUE HERE!! Spicy lived up to its name. 
We went with the Italian beef and Italian sausage, with sweet and hot peppers, wet, add cheese. He got fries, I went with the pasta salad as a side. 
HOLY WORDS I CAN NOT SAY ON YELP!!!! 
Seriously we just got this full off $30. One of the owners (or family members) even stopped by our table and said "wow for first timers I am impressed, are you from Chicago?"
We told him no, we just know good food, and we will be back! He realized last minute we were yelpers and said "make sure you write something nice!" He didn't realize I was already planning and writing my 5 star review since the salad. 
They also have mexican food on the menu. If I go back and like that too, I might just bring a sleeping bag and refuse to leave.

Amazing. I am from Chicago and I've been looking for a good Maxwell street style polish in Vegas. I've been to a bunch of Chicago food places including Windy City Beefs N Pizza and they all sell a large HOT DOG as a polish. So to finally have a real polish almost made me cry. Seriously. I'll be trying the italian beef next! Whoot!

I have been here to lunch twice during a workday. The service is excellent and fast.  The food quality is great.  I had the rotisserie 1/4 chicken with fries and a side salad.  Very tasty and moist chicken!  My friend had the lasagna which was good and looked homemade.  Thank you!  It's good to support a local small business.  There are fewer and fewer out there.

Started coming here about 4 months ago.  Mind you, I've lived in Las Vegas for over 20+ years and never even thought of coming in here.  I've passed this place SOOOO many times.  I must say, this place is a HIDDEN GEM.  Food is fresh, made to order and tastes amazing.  Not only is the food good the staff is amazing.  Everyone is very friendly, attentive and polite.  You can tell they enjoy their job and that makes a HUGE difference.  And it keeps me coming back to be honest.  All these years, I wish I had come here years ago!!!  You have to try the Italian Sausage!!!  That's all I get now!!!

I have been going to Sonio's for lunch since 2005.

It's amazing, and usually pretty healthy.

The spicy mexican chicken ceasar is the best salad I have had in vegas.

Their enchilada fries are pretty spectacular..........A light layer of nchilada sauce and melted cheese on crispy fries.

Their burritos and 1/2 chicken specials are great as well.

We need to keep places like this alive, unless you like an applebees on every corner.

This is the best place around for lunch!  It's family owned and operated, when you walk you're always greeted with a very warm welcome. My favorite is the Spicy Mexican Chicken Salad but all of the food is great.  It's nothing fancy but they have a great food and great customer service!

Its rare in Vegas to get pissed at yourself for not trying a place. This is one of those places. I wish they were open for dinner so i could bring the family. The food is spot on I havent had an Italian  beef sandwich that good in all of Vegas and the dogs to man this is the spot for lunch. If they ever decide to open for dinner this would be a regular spot for dinner. You cant beat the prices and the quailty of the food. O got to meantion also the service is just as good as the food they wouldnt let my drink go empty.

Great place with a lot of healthy options. I ordered a wrap combo with a side salad. The wrap was good and huge. I had to take the other half to go. The waitress was cool,  and so was the waiter making sure we were good.  I'm glad we cane in before the lunch rush.  I'll be back!

We were greeted as soon as we entered the door. This is one of those family owned businesses that cares about the quality of their food and service. It seems like every customer that came in here was known by the staff. The food comes out in large portions so you want walk away disappointed. 

The quality that goes into a meal here is like a forgotten art form or something. It tasted like a home cooked meal and not a rushed restaurant lunch special. The chicken caesar wrap was awesome and the pasta salad was better then most other places. Ill be back again for sure.

Sadly, Sonio's has dropped on the quality of food front.  My standard order of roasted chicken, pasta, spinach and feta salad, and roasted potatoes, was much lower in quality on my last visit than other prior visits.

Roasted chicken was dry, burnt in areas, and generally overcooked, roasted potatoes were hard, not tender and with little flavor, and pasta, spinach and feta salad lacked seasoning and was bland.

Regrettable as I considered Sonio's a local institution with reliably good quality, but, sadly, quality of food has slipped significantly.

No real information on this item, but Sonio's seemed different from prior visits - I got the sense that it was under new ownership, and that was part of the reason that food quality has suffered.

This reminds me of a small family type restaurant. I have ordered several to-go items and have enjoyed everyone. Their half chicken and two sides are well worth it. I'm one of these days I want to try their stuffed peppers. 

Glad they rebuild the restaurant. I remember the fire that closed them and I kept saying I should go.
Everything is amazing! My favorites are the tacos, rotisserie chicken and the Caesar salad. Yumm
I ate here yesterday, service is ok. Why did a lunch lemon chicken salad and soda cost $14.06? That's WAY TOO HIGH!

I've been eating at Sonio's Cafe since they opened. Over the years I've tried many items on their menu. Every single thing that I've ever eaten has been FANTASTIC!!! One of my favorite items is the chicken Caesars Salad. It's amazing. Also, Lilly is FANTASTIC. She always greets you with a beautiful smile and an even more beautiful attitude. In fact everyone that I've ever come in contact with is great. Gio, one of the owners, actually called me about an hour and a half after I placed a delivery order to make sure that I was satisfied. Of course I was very satisfied. I highly recommend Sonio's Cafe.

I have never had a bad meal...love this place!  Owner is so nice...they make great food. My favs are Mexican Caesar salad and chicken enchiladas. 

They are close to my work so I pick up or dine in. Staff is friendly and it's clean. They make a good mint lemonade too. I have been here over 20 times and still haven't tried it all....Hint: only open for lunch.

I saw a coworker eating from this place and it looked good so I tried to make an order for delivery.  I was told on the phone they don't deliver past 3 (it was 3:08)...strike one.   Two days later, I called for a delivery order again and they told me their delivery person wasnt there that day so they couldnt do deliveries....Strike two.  Called today (two weeks later) and they said they aren't doing deliveries today....Strike three.  Don't bring your brochures to me with Delivery on it and not offer it!!!!! You're only open til 5 why not just deliver that extra 2 hours!!!! Anyways, 3 tries  and nothing so you're out.

Passed by many times, but finally I made it in. Glad I did.
Uncle Ted was there, schooling an employee, from the sound of it. Not harshly,but in a fatherly way. Then an old friend (evidently) came in and it sounded like I was on the set of "Goodfellas ".
The waitress was friendly and attentive. I ordered a half chicken with beans and rice. It was delicious. The price, around $10, was fair. When I paid for my meal, I asked if they had plans to offer gluten free bread ( no gluten for me) and the gentleman told me they had thought about it but price and quality was an issue - he informed me that ANY sandwich could be had SANS bread. There's my solution. Easy squeezy.
So, the chicken and sides were great, the price fair, and the overall experience was pleasant. Plenty of seating, inside and out.
I'd definitely go back,  the menu offers many choices. 4 stars.

NOT FAMILY FRIENDLY!  This place could have had regular weekly customer, but instead, they blew it. I take my child to a therapist for medical issues next door there. Unfortunately, she is an older toddler who is not potty trained and needs changed frequently.  There is no bathroom at the small therapist office.   I thought I would check out the restaurant and use their restroom.  Upon walking in, I was accosted when I asked to use the restroom.  This is something I am not accustomed to.  Very rude.  They said I had to buy something in order to change my small child  in their restroom.  OK, fine, I buy the expensive lunch.  Then I proceed to wait quite awhile to get it, then I notice it has been sitting for some time and the counter person just never picked it up.  I take it home and eat the lasagna and salad. The salad is very good, the lasagna is average.  Kind of disappointing for the price. The place was so busy, I had higher hopes. I complain to my husband about this and he says it is probably because Sonio's is in a bad part of town with street people around.

Now this week, i desperately need a bathroom again. I plan on buying something,  per their rule.  There is a bad storm outside or else I might try to change her in the parking lot.  As I walk in I am asked about getting a table and say i need to use the restroom first.  This time I am rudely told that the restroom is closed because when they have deliveries, the restroom is closed.  Say what????????????????????  What restaurant is so bent on not letting people use the restroom, especially when they have a kid?   This is so rude and insensitive.  There are no other restaurants except across a busy intersection.  I dont understand why the employees dont show a bit of friendliness or understanding.  Doesnt anyone have kids?

I wont go there again.  They dont seem to care about their customers at all.  My customer service experience was completely negative.

Just visiting...looking for a decent place to feed the fam, away from the touristy area. About quarter to 12, the place is packed and a line has formed outside. Service is fast! The BIG bell announces when food is ready. The owner works behind the counter (makes awesome salads!), greets even the youngest customer. Definitely has rapport with locals, repeat customers and visitors like us. But what about the food?!?

Sonio's has great rotisserie chicken (known for),  big gorgeous salads, so-so with the American food fare (Chicago dogs- teenager review) and generous with their burritos (no kidding). The Spanish rice and crinkle cut fries were typical. But the chicken - definitely yuuummmy! Reason for the 3 stars? They charge you a fee for splitting a meal which in my view was an extra paper plate. When I asked, they said it was on the menu... don't recall seeing it. 

So come for the awesome food, the cool owner, the vibe of the place but beware of fees!

I recently visited this popular lunch establishment and to my disappointment, the gentleman who seemed to be the guy in charge walking around stated that the burrito is not offered for lunch. I was bummed because I traveled specifically for the burrito. I had their rotisserie chicken and it good, but not mind blowing.

The food is great. I've honestly never had anything here that wasn't excellent. The Italian Beef is, in my opinion, about as good as it gets. Make sure you get both sweet and hot peppers. You're missing out if you don't. 

But beyond the food, the service is the best. I'm fairly new to a city, and it's really wonderful to go into a place where people are kind every single time. I went one week, and was having the worst week, wasn't sure how I was ever going to stay in Vegas... and I left Sonio's smiling. Great homey food. Even better people. I would recommend to anyone.

A man and a MICROWAVE....Need I say more! Came here based on the reviews and I now believe that most people think that crap food is actually good food. This low level dog food they serve here is nothing but microwaved pre-prepared food. All I heard running the entire time I was here was the dinging of the microwave in the back of the kitchen. The lasagna came out so hot that it was obvious that it was heated for like 15 minutes this way. It was a sour tasting heap of disgust. The Chicago dogs were skinny little funky tasking microwaved little Snausages; that only a dog would even dare to eat. The ranch salad dressing tasted and looked like it had been watered down beyond belief. It was so runny that when eating it on a salad it wouldn't even stick to the lettuce. They NO LONGER HAVE THEIR CHICKEN MONSTER BURRITO either; as they indicated that they are getting rid of their mexican food completely. I saw it in the prior reviews and wanted to try it, but NOPE all GONE!  DING. DING. DING... what's that you say? It's the friggen microwave going off yet again with someone else's order being prepared. Funny thing is that this place gets a bit busy during lunch; it's obviously a bunch of clueless people who know zilch about good tasting quality food. This place is NOT worth the DRIVE. Let me repeat, DO NOT BOTHER DRIVING HERE TO TRY THEIR CRAP QUALITY AND CRAP MICROWAVED FOODS. You need to close your doors and open a Tire shop; because that's pretty much what your food tastes like...old stinky rubber!

Ah Sonio's. What can I say about this place?  It is really good food. I have had the Italian beef and Combo sandwiches when I have come in. They are fantastic. The service is great. I looked across the room at lunch and it was pretty busy. The food on others tables looked amazing too. I especially think the tacos may be my next order. The salads come in huge bowls so they would be easy to toss more if you need to. All in all, a great place to eat.

Been driving past here for 20 years.
Best Chicago Style Italian beef Sandwiches I have had in a Long time
Do yourself a favor And please stop by!
If your from Chicago, rejoice.

Ordered food to go today. While the food is very good , the service is not.

The food runner was very rude and as I was leaving, knowing I was upset yelled  " thank you and have a good Day" to irritate me. 

Condescending, rude and Unprofessional!

I've been coming to Sonio's since 2004. 

Why? 

1) The food is consistently good. Sonio's has a varied menu of offerings. Their most famous (and longest running) item would be the rotisserie chicken. They also have Mexican food ranging from chicken tacos, enchiladas or their 2 pound burrito that is the size of some people's shoes.  Speaking of gigantic, check out the salads. They don't skimp on the ingredients and the salads are served in wooden bowls large enough for punch. There are newer things on the menu ranging from sausage sandwiches, stuffed bell peppers or lasagna (Mama Mia!). Needless to say, unless you have a tape worm or are a competitive eater, you should be full with whatever you order. The portions are generous on most dishes!

Vegetarian? No problem. They have many things to cater to you.

Looking for Paleo or Low Carb options? They have that too!

For the amount of food and the variety of people they cater to, the prices are more than fair. 

2) The service is excellent. This is a family run business and if you become a regular there, the staff will remember your name. It's such a great feeling when I'm walking in and Lily or Yiorgo will greet me by my name. Uncle Teddy can usually be seen hanging out in his booth and he's always asking me, "How's your boyfriend? You tell 'im I said hi."  or "How've you been? Good to see you!" Matt will constantly check on my table to make sure the drinks are always full. These interactions don't make me feel like just another customer, but rather like a VIP or part of the family. Every single time, the quality of service from this team shines and I always leave feeling full from the food and fulfilled from the hospitality. 



These two reasons are why I keep coming to Sonio's and why I will continue to give them my business. It's rare to find a local homegrown place where you get that kind of experience with a good fresh meal to boot. These are the kinds of businesses that Vegas need to support. 

If you're in the area and looking for a laid back local lunch spot, I encourage you to give Sonio's a try. Oh, and tell the crew I said, "Hi." ;)

I just ate the Gyro sandwich combo and let me say it was disgusting! What an insult to REAL gyros! I had no other option but to eat it so I didn't starve but do NOT get this dish!! The gyro wasn't authentic at all! Instead of the lamb being shaved (which is the correct way) they must have cooked it on a grill and cut it up. NEVER DO THAT!!! Then the cucumber sauce to go with it was the worst I have ever had! First it had this weird color to it then they added weird spices so it didn't taste right. The only thing they got right about the sauce was that it had some cucumbers in it. Unfortunately my coworkers had chosen this place to pick up food from and because of this horrible dish I will never order anything from here again!! Sadly I had to spend $8.99 for this disgusting food, too!! 

DO NOT GO HERE!!!! 

Also, one of my coworkers ordered the Baja Burrito and she said it was too spicy and just "ok". There was nothing special about it and it looked like a big blob.

Sonio's has the best beef sandwich in Las Vegas hands down.  The way to order it is with everything, including provolone cheese.  The au jus that comes with it is so good it just might be God's tears in a little cup, I've never had better au jus.  I highly recommend bringing a bib or apron because the sandwich juices are dripping the way a true good sandwich does.  The price is a little heavy but definitely worth it.  Service is pretty good, and the guy behind the counter is pretty damn funny.  I go there at least once a week and will keep going back.  I just wish they had a henderson location.

You have to try this place! The service is always on point, the variety of food is so crazy but everything is prepared so great, and the environment is just a lot of fun. The rotisserie chicken is always juicy and delicious but if you want a great Chicago hotdog this is the place. The beef sandwiches are made perfect and the Greek food is always very good.

Cafe located on Charleston and valley view. The menu has a big menu of different selections. This place is known for their rotisserie chicken. Order ahead! I went in for lunch, and it was pretty busy for just opening up. I went with the half chicken, paired w Greek fries and a side Caesar salad. Proportion sizes for all three were big! The chicken was a little bland and too peppered for my liking, my fries were soggy, the salad was good... paid about $14 for lunch. They also have burgers, salads, and hot dogs available to choose as well!

Wanted to try something new for lunch and happened to pass this cafe and are checking it out. It is a Chicago style eatery that is decorated with wonderful mural art on the wall. It is a hotdog haven and I could not be happier with kraut. Guests are escorted to eat table side with a server that waits on you. The service here is very good and with such a small business it is very very pleasant and busy busy. 

We decided to stay authentic and go Chicago style with that special too which includes 2 Hotdogs with sauerkraut,mayo, and onions with french fries for $8.99. What a great deal too? One must experience meatballs if getting their Chicago on! So we paired the hotdogs with a four order of meatballs in sauce too. 

The food being Chicago style also transported us back to when we visited there. This was my twin sons experience with sauerkraut it takes me back to when I first tried mine in Germany. Actually we talked about it over lunch. The meatballs were oh so good and made to perfection. I like how they are also served cold which is how they are served in the Windy City.

Definitely a small Vegas gem. I've eaten at Sonios for years! The food is very good and consistant! Never had a bad meal. The BEST thing about this place is the staff. They are FAST, very friendly... treat you like youre family, and after going a few times they even remember your name and what you like to drink! You can get good food at a lot of places at Sonios - but good food combined with their wacky family makes you feel like you're a part of this place! (Chicken ceasar salad and the combo wrap are my favorites!)

Oh man. This place is amazing. My boyfriend and I were on our way to an appointment when we stopped by and grabbed a bite to eat. He had the hot dog with everything and I got their tacos. Both delicious! What was really great was the customer service. Gio came to our table and introduced himself and made sure everything was alright. Same with our server. Just a great place to eat at.

Eat This - chicago style polish, greek fries, spinach & feta pasta
Not Cr*p - rotiserrie chicken

The $14 groupon goes a long way & there's plenty of selections to make that $14 worthwhile.

Absolutely nothing spectacular comes to mind regarding the rotiserrie chicken & the faux seasoning is mentally agitating. That this review is forced to move on to better things.

Their sides!

The humble after thoughts of a meal are the centerpieces in assembling a potentially good lunch. Spinach & feta pasta salad; floating sensations of savory dressing, light & abstract tinges of cheese. Health lovers rejoice! Herb& cheese greek fries homely & comforting, these are not the animal-style fries you ordered for.

A dog, a polish, chicago style polish, its not a maxwell street style polish, its a made to order vienna beef polish. In true chi-town ordering tradition "a polish with everything please". How's that for 14 bucks!
Beat Chicago food I've EVER had including place in Chicago. My favorite place to go for lunch in town. Highly recommend the Italian Beef Combo
This place is good! Looks like a hole in the wall, but the food is seriously good. Had the enchilada plate, and it was super tasty. Salads and sandwiches all looked good too. Would def go again.

This place is all about customer service. Every time I go in they greet me by name. They are incredibly friendly as most family run businesses are. They have a broad menu ranging from fried and greasy Chicago food to healthier, Greek options. I love this spot and prefer their food to all of the chain restaurants in the area.

Sonio's, which specializes in rotiserrie chicken has a pretty loyal following. I'd heard about it for years through word of mouth. This popular restaurant was rebuilt after it was badly damaged by a fire a few years ago. I had lunch with a good friend here, who highly recommended the salad. It was packed during lunch, which is not unusual- it's kind of small and situated in a strip mall across the street from the Las Vegas Valley Water District on Charleston/Valley View. The salads are huge. (If you are not hungry, I would recommend splitting it or ordering something else.) I got the chinese chicken salad (fave salad), which I really enjoyed. My friend got a different salad (she'd been here before, many times). We each sampled a bit of each other's salad, but I liked mine better. Also available are sandwiches. 

I ordered a two piece meal plus sides, to go, for my husband. It was taking a long time so I finally went up to the counter. Somehow the order was not placed. When my husband ate it for dinner, he found the chicken a bit dry, and in general, was not impressed.
I had dropped my van off to have some repairs done near this restaurant. I walked over with my three kids to have lunch. I was so amazed at the friendliness of the staff. The food was amazing!!!

There is a reason this place always has customers. The food and service are amazing. You know a place is good when cops eat there, and there is generally a group of them there whenever I go in. The owner himself is super friendly and is working around lunchtime, so that keep his staff on point. They now even have healthy options for those of us who could lose a few pounds.

This restaurant is just across the street from our dental office.  We frequently treat our staff to lunch and they love the food from Sonio's.  You can't go wrong with anything you eat here.  Chinese chicken salad and Italian beef sandwiches are two of our favorites.  I love the rice as a side.  Enchiladas are another one of my favorites.   Give this place a try and you will be happy you did!

Old Vegas Tony sat on a booth while we enjoyed our salads.   Tony is a great guy, very friendly and makes the place unique.   The food was wonderful.   Had a salad with chicken that came in a large size bowl.   Excellent and filling.   My friend had the Greek salad.   She really enjoyed it.   Both were happy with the service and the atmosphere.   The reason its 4 instead of 5 stars is that the food is wonderful, but not amazing.   I tend to reserve the highest rating for amazing food and/or places.   However, it is wonderful and Yay, I'm a fan.

Not impressed at all. Worst service I've ever had. Amigo passed us 3 times as we waved him down to take our order. Don't quit your day job... Never again. Food wasn't any different then any other dine-in environment. Just completely disappointed.
The stuffed peppers are the bomb. Like mom used to make.

I went here for the first time last week. The lemon chicken caesar salad was perfect. It had a nice touch of lemon not overbearing. The chicken was quality white meat, the croutons were fresh and the sauce not over powering, crisp lettuce. They did a great job and a fair price for the amount and quality of the food.

The service was very good as well. If you are dining in your cup stays full with water or tea or whatever beverage u are drinking. The staff is attentive and listend carefully when you make requests.

Uncle Teddy and Yio are the owners. Uncle Teddy is a friendly cool guy from Chicago and he has great stories and a welcoming personality. His son Yio looks like the day to day manager and he welcomes everyone and knows most of the people by name.

I would say for lunch or an early dinner this is a great local spot to come. It is family friendly, in an older part of town, adequate parking, outdoor seating.

I will definitely be back their lasagna and rotisserie meats look amazing.

I couldn't get seated last week at noon (too crowded), so  returned at 11:30 yesterday when there were plenty of empty tables. I was enjoying my Greek salad with white meat chicken and the attentive service when they seated at the next table a man with a very large pistol in a holster on his hip. He did not appear to be in law enforcement. It made uneasy. I asked for a to-go box and left. It would be nice if the restaurant posted a "no guns" sign.

Sonio's is one of the BEST places to eat in Vegas, not only for their excellent food choices, delicious cuisine and huge portions, but because it's like going to your family's house for a home cooked meal.  The staff is on top of their game and everyone who works there makes you feel welcome and special.  They take pride in their establishment and in particular their customer service.  It's also nice that their menu is vast and has a variety of food choices. I have had different dishes from there, both in the restaurant and to go (my office orders from there often) and I have never disliked anything I have had.  Instead, I am thoroughly impressed each and every time.  I can't say enough good things about the staff's outstanding customer service and the delectable food served.  100% the best of the best!
Amazing lunch experience! The Italian beef wet hit he spot, they also have the most amazing homemade salad dressing! Don't forget your Greek fries! Thanks sonios!!!

Today was my first time coming into this establishment. I was very impressed with the people who work there and even ordered something off the menu that the waitress suggested. I ordered a single hot dog with all of the toppings, the french fries and a side of ranch dressing. The hot dog had this bright neon green relish on top of it, that tasted a little off and felt rubbery. The hot dog itself was pretty small, and was barely lukewarm. Needless to say I was not impressed.  The french fries were very good, and the ranch dressing was a little watered down. I might give this place another chance, but it would have to be because I was in the area. They are not worth driving for.
Solid, good for you food amongst a very busy street of fast food places. Quality mom and pop food at reasonable prices. Huge portions and exceptional customer service. Very friendly staff!
Great food, great portions and great people.  Highly recommend the Italian beef sandwich!!

Great food. Exceptional service. I'll definitely be going back there soon.
I had two Chicago Dogs with fries and great homemade lemonade for under $10. A great deal for sure. The restaurant is comfortable and the staff is great. 
Next time I'm trying one of the salads that looks like two meals in a bowl. 
If you're into Paleo food they've got that covered too.

I am kind of dittoing a previous review by Stefany below, this place would get 3.5 stars, but the service is so good that it is okay to round up to 4. Decided to try this joint for lunch. I went in not knowing what to expect and came out relatively pleased. I wish they had chilli for their hotdogs though. I think that lone addition would push this up another star. Their menu is quite different and I was not pleased with the selection. It took me a while to decide what to eat. When I did I went this their polish sausage. The portion was quite large and pretty good. I cannot say that I would return, unless of course they added chili to their menu. But, if you are a fan of Chicago style hot dogs, polish sausage. or rotisserie chicken you should give this place a try. The service alone makes it worth a visit. The servers are very friendly and the service was very quick.

I haven't been here in a few years, since the last time I was in Vegas, but i'm dying to go back.. their chicken was amazing. I follow their facebook page and get updates on new additions to the menu. Can't wait to go back!

First time at this place. First thing I noticed was their amazing hospitality. The food was great and the waitress was very helpful with suggestions. The owners were soo friendly, must be that Midwestern hospitality. This is a must. :)

Had my first visit here today. I will be going back. It was super busy for lunch and the service was fast and efficient. The tables are close together, but the food was amazing. I had the Italian beef it was get the right amount of wet and so flavorful every bite was like a party in my mouth. And even though they were busy I was in and out in less than an hour. 

I was also slightly entertained that the staff communicated with each other by yelling. The main man in charge was barking out orders to his crew like a drill sergenat. It wasn't rude, it was endearing. Everyone was super friendly and very fast.
Great service, friendly people and delicious food. Definitely a must try. This is coming from a Greek girl too ;p

A salad the size of a small baby? Yes! I am a fan. I have only been here once and had only one thing: the Mexican Chicken Caesar, which is described as a Caesar with a kick. It came served in what would typically be a bowl for a salad intended to serve a small dinner party! It was super simple: fresh, green romaine, cheese, chunks of their rotisserie chicken and as promised, a spicy caesar dressing. Despite being simple, it definitely hit the spot. 

The vibe is definitely old school, as the spot has been around for a while, so don't expect fancy. (They actually have doilies over the booth backs!) However, there was quick service with a smile. Our glasses never ran dry!

Note: If you check in on Yelp, you receive 10% off. 

I would definitely revisit for lunch if I am craving a salad!

Never fails here!!! Like seriously!!! Food is amazing!
Are you a burger fanatic like I am?? If so you're going to want to try the burger from here! 
*The meat is seriously made fresh and tastes just like a homemade burger, veggies are so so fresh like you would expect a burger to have. And their famous secret sauce is so darn good!!! 
This burger by far is one of the freshest scrumptious burgers over ever had at a restaurant 
Best freaking burgers ever!!! But wait there's more, don't let me forget to tell you about the crinkle wrinkle fries?!!! 
I don't know what it is about those crinkle wrinkly fries but they are bombbb! 
Sooo fresh and just fried to perfection! Tastes like how damn damn fries are suppose to taste! 
I never can get enough fries I always order a try when I'm here 

**Gyro was bomb as well!!! Meat was cooked to perfection and it was seasoned so well! The toppings were so fresh and the sauce that came with it was so good and you can tell it was homemade 

-Wow that home made bbq sauce and the chicken Chinese salad sauce they make from scratch is freakin amazing! Salad so fresh too wow! 

*now for That rotisserie chicken! WOW, the chicken was super juicy and tender, cooked so well to perfection. Haven't had chicken this juicy and moist!!wow! Now I know why they are known for their rotisserie Yummy 
 ** GREAT little Mom and Pops place. Staffs here are a lot better than before. It had a very welcoming feel and staffs are so attentive and friendly 
If you are every in Vegas and want great food without breaking the bank this is the place to come you won't be disappointed
I got the Italian beef, it's was awesome! Just like back home and the staff was great! I WILL be back and will recommend to all my friends.

I cant believe this place has been here for so long and I never knew about it! Perfect Mom N Pop shop located in an aged part of Vegas. 

Very casual spot with many regulars who frequent ( i would definitely be a regular too if i lived in Vegas) I had the rotisserie 1/2 chicken with rice and hot potatoes as the sides. Delicious meal with attentive service. The whole staff seemed to communicate well like family.

Heard the Chicago Style Dogs were pretty tasty too! I will definitely come back for those. Filling and Satisfied!

If you're looking for good rotisserie chicken with a Mexiterranean twist, Sonio's is the place to go.

A popular lunch hangout for everyone from office workers to local TV news crews, everything at Sonio's is made fresh.  The spicy chicken Caesar salad is among one of my favorite dishes -- along with the traditional Mexican fare and Mediterranean side dishes.

As for the rotisserie chicken and homemade pitas, I have never left the place feeling unsatisfied.   They're that good.

I've driven by Sonio's a million times. I've heard people talk about it being their go-to lunch spot. Well, I recently decided to stop. 

I don't know if it's because I ordered the wrong thing or that I because I've become conscientious of what I'm eating, but it was just okay. It was great and it wasn't bad. It's right in there with Applebees.

I ordered the Not Your Typical Cobb. It is labeled as having veggies, chicken, feta, and croutons. I ordered it without the croutons and have the cheese. The salad arrived and it was huge! However, the salad came riddled with tiny pieces of macaroni and veggies included: green peppers, tomatoes, and shredded carrots. This doesn't account for veggies for me. The salad was very meh. Nothing special and nothing I couldn't have made at home.

My counterpart ordered the Italian beef combo which is a huge sausage (that's what she said) with Chicago style beef. It was well received. I ordered my grandma a to-go lasagna and she's picky, she loved it.

The place is very casual. Booths. Tables. Cute kitsch. It feels like a diner, but has a hole-in-the-wall, mom and pop-feel to it. 

Our waitress was kind, attentive, and prompt. Prices were affordable. Menu items are hit or miss. I definitely will give it another go and be sure to ask more questions in the future!

Stopped by after wondering around looking for a place to eat. This is a great place to eat. Much better then the over priced stuff on the strip. The meatball sub is awesome! Great service! The owner Yiorgo came out and visited with us and let us try the cannoli's, these were great as well. You must try the homemade Mint Lime Lemonade (very unique and refreshing).

If you're looking for dry chicken and chicken pasta salad with WAY too much mayonnaise then this is the place for you. The Mexican chicken salad is a joke.  They dump red Chile flakes to make it "Mexican" apparently. The rib bones that came attached to several pieces of chicken was free of charge though!!  Pretty lazy not to properly debone the chicken for the salad!!  Not the same quality this place was a few years ago!  Go to Nevada Chicken, MUCH BETTER choice!  On a positive note, the lettuce for the side salad was extremely fresh and crispy if you could find it under the gallon of dressing they applied.

The current incarnation of Sonio's Cafe has been revamped since a raging fire burnt the original one down in late 04 (or was it early 05?). Fire be damned, Sonio's is hands down one of the best rotisserie chicken cafe's I have ever visited. 

As noted in the last review, this is a very popular lunchtime destination. If you are not there by 11:15 AM, expect a full house with a line out the door and around the corner. Thank goodness the wait staff are experts at moving the crowds through, so while you may have to wait, it is usually for not longer than 10-15 minutes. 

My all time favorite dish is the Mexican Caesar salad. Served up in a bowl the size of a large kitchen colander, you get a mountain of greens and roasted chicken, all done up with just the right amount of a spicy version of a Caesar dressing. Add in a couple of handfuls toasted pita bread crumbles, and you have the perfect salad/meal! I have also had several of the pitas and wraps and was equally impressed and satisfied with the portion size and quality. 

Even if you don't work (or aren't staying) anywhere near their location on the corner of Charleston and Valley View, this is one place that makes a trip across town or away from the strip absolutely worth it!

This place is amazing! Not only was the food amazing but the staff went above and beyond my expectations.  They were so attentive and friendly. They kept ensuring that my drinks were refilled and that I was satisfied. I walked out of there with a big smile on my face and even said "wow". Now that is customer service! I had the chicken enchilada plate and their extra side order of sour cream was the biggest portion I've ever seen. Overall, I had a wonderful experience here today. I don't usually write reviews, but I had to commend the staff here. I will definitely be returning again.
This is my go to work lunch meet up or carry out.  Hot, good food.  Staff are amazingly friendly.  Good prices.  Quality place.

This review is a long time coming.  If you're from Chicago and are in need to fill the food void, this is the place.  If all the places I've eaten an Italian Beef or here, Sonio's tops the list.  The price is reasonable, especially because it includes fries.  The beef contains a good amount of meat, and is seasoned about the best that I've ever had.

I've also had a few of their salads.  All are good sized and always fresh.  The staff is friendly; Uncle Teddy is always around to ensure you have a great experience.    Sonio's Cafe is a solid local business that deserves plenty of Vegas support, especially from Chicagoans looking for a beef or dog.

This place is really good, it used to be fantastic. I have been here at least 25 times, over several years. Once they switched to plastic utensils, the overall character seemed to change too.  But, they bounced back,  I'm not sure what it was, but they got it back. And that is good news for chicken fans everywhere.

This has been a favorite place of mine since it was Sonia's.  The salads in the wooden bowels are amazing  My favorite is the Chinese Chicken.  The wraps and rotisserie chicken are among the best.  The also do Mexican food well.  Extensive menu, fast service and friendly ambience make Sonio's the go to neighborhood lunch place.  Vegetarian-friendly.

I have been going to Sonio's for a few years now. I actually found out about it when I worked near there and couldn't find much to eat for lunch in the area. I was delighted to find a healthy option. And, I stop in every time I'm near by from across town. When I went there for the first time I got to meet the owners and they were very welcoming. These guys have a class act of providing original recipes for the main dishes they serve and you can enjoy taking home their canned sauces and condiments. One of the best parts is, if you are out of time to cook for your family dinner you can grab a huge tray of lasagna and pop that goodness into the oven at home. My family loves it! Please never under estimate the savory flavors of an original Chicago dog and stop in soon! Highly recommend!

Take out experience was great! My coworker and I both stopped for our first experience. The gentlemen at the cashier was super friendly and helpful, even in the midst of what was clearly a busy time. He gave great pointers and recommendations. The food was awesome...I had the rotisserie chicken and my coworker the Italian Beef. Definitely a new found favorite.

We stopped in here on a whim because a bunch of people had recommended it to me. First off, the service is frickin awesome! Everyone's askin you if you need anything or if they can help you with something. The menu is a little smattering of everything. There's some Greek food, some Mexican, with Chicago style hot dogs and deli sandwiches. I was thisclose to trying the Mexican food, but then I ordered the Firedog with fries. SUPER YUMMY! It totally hit the spot. My buddies said their beef sandwiches were pretty legit too. Stop in here for some good food and AMAZING service. Oh this place tends to get packed at kunchtime, so try to swing in early!

Another food excursion we made due to our Groupon. 

Tried the Chinese Chicken Rollup and the Combo Chicken Rollup. A little on the expensive side, but the food quantities are pretty big, so I guess that evens out. We ended up sharing one Rollup and saving the other for lunch the next day. The food was a little on the oily side. I wish it wasn't so saturated in oil. The potatoes were pretty oily and underseasoned as well. I think the chicken is good and fresh, but a little dry and also underseasoned.

Overall, it was ok, but since their hours are so limited, the food is a little bland and it's not particularly close to me, I probably won't be back too often.

Very busy place, was packed but still figured out a way to accommodate our party of six. The owner was actively working the place and told us to call ahead, he will reserve tables for larger groups. The seating is designed for a party of four. The food was great and large portions. I will go back.
